service:
AWS IoT Events monitors your equipment or device fleets for failures or changes in operation, and triggers actions when such events occur. You can use AWS IoT Events Data API commands to send inputs to detectors, list detectors, and view or update a detector's status.

For more information, see What is AWS IoT Events? in the AWS IoT Events Developer Guide.

operations.BatchAcknowledgeAlarm: Acknowledges one or more alarms. The alarms change to the ACKNOWLEDGED state after you acknowledge them.
operations.BatchDisableAlarm: Disables one or more alarms. The alarms change to the DISABLED state after you disable them.
operations.BatchEnableAlarm: Enables one or more alarms. The alarms change to the NORMAL state after you enable them.
operations.BatchPutMessage: Sends a set of messages to the AWS IoT Events system. Each message payload is transformed into the input you specify ("inputName") and ingested into any detectors that monitor that input. If multiple messages are sent, the order in which the messages are processed isn't guaranteed. To guarantee ordering, you must send messages one at a time and wait for a successful response.
operations.BatchResetAlarm: Resets one or more alarms. The alarms return to the NORMAL state after you reset them.
operations.BatchSnoozeAlarm: Changes one or more alarms to the snooze mode. The alarms change to the SNOOZE_DISABLED state after you set them to the snooze mode.
operations.BatchUpdateDetector: Updates the state, variable values, and timer settings of one or more detectors (instances) of a specified detector model.
operations.ListAlarms: Lists one or more alarms. The operation returns only the metadata associated with each alarm.
operations.ListDetectors: Lists detectors (the instances of a detector model).

AcknowledgeActionConfiguration.base: Contains the configuration information of an acknowledge action.

refs.CustomerAction$acknowledgeActionConfigur: Contains the configuration information of an acknowledge action.

refs.BatchAcknowledgeAlarmRequest$acknowledge: The list of acknowledge action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.

AlarmState.base: Contains information about the current state of the alarm.

refs.Alarm$alarmState: Contains information about the current state of the alarm.

refs.AlarmState$stateName:
The name of the alarm state. The state name can be one of the following values:

  • DISABLED - When the alarm is in the DISABLED state, it isn't ready to evaluate data. To enable the alarm, you must change the alarm to the NORMAL state.

  • NORMAL - When the alarm is in the NORMAL state, it's ready to evaluate data.

  • ACTIVE - If the alarm is in the ACTIVE state, the alarm is invoked.

  • ACKNOWLEDGED - When the alarm is in the ACKNOWLEDGED state, the alarm was invoked and you acknowledged the alarm.

  • SNOOZE_DISABLED - When the alarm is in the SNOOZE_DISABLED state, the alarm is disabled for a specified period of time. After the snooze time, the alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state.

  • LATCHED - When the alarm is in the LATCHED state, the alarm was invoked. However, the data that the alarm is currently evaluating is within the specified range. To change the alarm to the NORMAL state, you must acknowledge the alarm.
refs.AlarmSummary$stateName:
The name of the alarm state. The state name can be one of the following values:

  • DISABLED - When the alarm is in the DISABLED state, it isn't ready to evaluate data. To enable the alarm, you must change the alarm to the NORMAL state.

  • NORMAL - When the alarm is in the NORMAL state, it's ready to evaluate data.

  • ACTIVE - If the alarm is in the ACTIVE state, the alarm is invoked.

  • ACKNOWLEDGED - When the alarm is in the ACKNOWLEDGED state, the alarm was invoked and you acknowledged the alarm.

  • SNOOZE_DISABLED - When the alarm is in the SNOOZE_DISABLED state, the alarm is disabled for a specified period of time. After the snooze time, the alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state.

  • LATCHED - When the alarm is in the LATCHED state, the alarm was invoked. However, the data that the alarm is currently evaluating is within the specified range. To change the alarm to the NORMAL state, you must acknowledge the alarm.

refs.BatchAcknowledgeAlarmResponse$errorEntri: A list of errors associated with the request, or null if there are no errors. Each error entry contains an entry ID that helps you identify the entry that failed.
refs.BatchDisableAlarmResponse$errorEntries: A list of errors associated with the request, or null if there are no errors. Each error entry contains an entry ID that helps you identify the entry that failed.
refs.BatchEnableAlarmResponse$errorEntries: A list of errors associated with the request, or null if there are no errors. Each error entry contains an entry ID that helps you identify the entry that failed.
refs.BatchResetAlarmResponse$errorEntries: A list of errors associated with the request, or null if there are no errors. Each error entry contains an entry ID that helps you identify the entry that failed.
refs.BatchSnoozeAlarmResponse$errorEntries: A list of errors associated with the request, or null if there are no errors. Each error entry contains an entry ID that helps you identify the entry that failed.

BatchAlarmActionErrorEntry.base:
Contains error messages associated with one of the following requests:

  • BatchAcknowledgeAlarm

  • BatchDisableAlarm

  • BatchEnableAlarm

  • BatchResetAlarm

  • BatchSnoozeAlarm

refs.BatchPutMessageResponse$BatchPutMessageE: A list of any errors encountered when sending the messages.

refs.BatchUpdateDetectorResponse$batchUpdateD: A list of those detector updates that resulted in errors. (If an error is listed here, the specific update did not occur.)

BatchUpdateDetectorErrorEntry.base: Information about the error that occurred when attempting to update a detector.

CustomerAction.base: Contains information about the action that you can take to respond to the alarm.

refs.AlarmState$customerAction: Contains information about the action that you can take to respond to the alarm.

refs.CustomerAction$actionName:
The name of the action. The action name can be one of the following values:

  • SNOOZE - When you snooze the alarm, the alarm state changes to SNOOZE_DISABLED.

  • ENABLE - When you enable the alarm, the alarm state changes to NORMAL.

  • DISABLE - When you disable the alarm, the alarm state changes to DISABLED.

  • ACKNOWLEDGE - When you acknowledge the alarm, the alarm state changes to ACKNOWLEDGED.

  • RESET - When you reset the alarm, the alarm state changes to NORMAL.

For more information, see the AlarmState API.

refs.DescribeDetectorRequest$detectorModelNam: The name of the detector model whose detectors (instances) you want information about.
refs.Detector$detectorModelName: The name of the detector model that created this detector (instance).
refs.DetectorSummary$detectorModelName: The name of the detector model that created this detector (instance).
refs.ListDetectorsRequest$detectorModelName: The name of the detector model whose detectors (instances) are listed.
refs.UpdateDetectorRequest$detectorModelName: The name of the detector model that created the detectors (instances).

refs.Detector$detectorModelVersion: The version of the detector model that created this detector (instance).
refs.DetectorSummary$detectorModelVersion: The version of the detector model that created this detector (instance).

DetectorState.base: Information about the current state of the detector instance.

DetectorStateDefinition.base: The new state, variable values, and timer settings of the detector (instance).

refs.UpdateDetectorRequest$state: The new state, variable values, and timer settings of the detector (instance).

refs.ListDetectorsResponse$detectorSummaries: A list of summary information about the detectors (instances).

DisableActionConfiguration.base: Contains the configuration information of a disable action.

refs.CustomerAction$disableActionConfiguratio: Contains the configuration information of a disable action.

refs.BatchDisableAlarmRequest$disableActionRe: The list of disable action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.

EnableActionConfiguration.base: Contains the configuration information of an enable action.

refs.CustomerAction$enableActionConfiguration: Contains the configuration information of an enable action.

refs.BatchEnableAlarmRequest$enableActionRequ: The list of enable action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.

refs.Message$inputName: The name of the input into which the message payload is transformed.

refs.TimestampValue$timeInMillis: The value of the timestamp, in the Unix epoch format.

refs.SystemEvent$eventType: The event type. If the value is STATE_CHANGE, the event contains information about alarm state changes.

refs.SimpleRuleEvaluation$inputPropertyValue: The value of the input property, on the left side of the comparison operator.

refs.AcknowledgeAlarmActionRequest$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.Alarm$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.AlarmSummary$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.DescribeAlarmRequest$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.DescribeDetectorRequest$keyValue: A filter used to limit results to detectors (instances) created because of the given key ID.
refs.Detector$keyValue: The value of the key (identifying the device or system) that caused the creation of this detector (instance).
refs.DetectorSummary$keyValue: The value of the key (identifying the device or system) that caused the creation of this detector (instance).
refs.DisableAlarmActionRequest$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.EnableAlarmActionRequest$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.ResetAlarmActionRequest$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.SnoozeAlarmActionRequest$keyValue: The value of the key used as a filter to select only the alarms associated with the key.
refs.UpdateDetectorRequest$keyValue: The value of the input key attribute (identifying the device or system) that caused the creation of this detector (instance).

refs.ListAlarmsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.
refs.ListDetectorsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

refs.BatchPutMessageErrorEntry$messageId: The ID of the message that caused the error. (See the value corresponding to the "messageId" key in the "message" object.)
refs.BatchUpdateDetectorErrorEntry$messageId: The "messageId" of the update request that caused the error. (The value of the "messageId" in the update request "Detector" object.)
refs.Message$messageId: The ID to assign to the message. Within each batch sent, each "messageId" must be unique.
refs.UpdateDetectorRequest$messageId: The ID to assign to the detector update "message". Each "messageId" must be unique within each batch sent.

refs.BatchPutMessageRequest$messages: The list of messages to send. Each message has the following format: '{ "messageId": "string", "inputName": "string", "payload": "string"}'

refs.ListAlarmsRequest$nextToken: The token that you can use to return the next set of results.
refs.ListAlarmsResponse$nextToken: The token that you can use to return the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.
refs.ListDetectorsRequest$nextToken: The token that you can use to return the next set of results.
refs.ListDetectorsResponse$nextToken: The token that you can use to return the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

refs.AcknowledgeActionConfiguration$note: The note that you can leave when you acknowledge the alarm.
refs.AcknowledgeAlarmActionRequest$note: The note that you can leave when you acknowledge the alarm.
refs.DisableActionConfiguration$note: The note that you can leave when you disable the alarm.
refs.DisableAlarmActionRequest$note: The note that you can leave when you disable the alarm.
refs.EnableActionConfiguration$note: The note that you can leave when you enable the alarm.
refs.EnableAlarmActionRequest$note: The note that you can leave when you enable the alarm.
refs.ResetActionConfiguration$note: The note that you can leave when you reset the alarm.
refs.ResetAlarmActionRequest$note: The note that you can leave when you reset the alarm.
refs.SnoozeActionConfiguration$note: The note that you can leave when you snooze the alarm.
refs.SnoozeAlarmActionRequest$note: The note that you can leave when you snooze the alarm.

refs.Message$payload: The payload of the message. This can be a JSON string or a Base-64-encoded string representing binary data (in which case you must decode it).

refs.AcknowledgeAlarmActionRequest$requestId: The request ID. Each ID must be unique within each batch.
refs.BatchAlarmActionErrorEntry$requestId: The request ID. Each ID must be unique within each batch.
refs.DisableAlarmActionRequest$requestId: The request ID. Each ID must be unique within each batch.
refs.EnableAlarmActionRequest$requestId: The request ID. Each ID must be unique within each batch.
refs.ResetAlarmActionRequest$requestId: The request ID. Each ID must be unique within each batch.
refs.SnoozeAlarmActionRequest$requestId: The request ID. Each ID must be unique within each batch.

ResetActionConfiguration.base: Contains the configuration information of a reset action.

refs.CustomerAction$resetActionConfiguration: Contains the configuration information of a reset action.

refs.BatchResetAlarmRequest$resetActionReques: The list of reset action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.

refs.TimerDefinition$seconds: The new setting of the timer (the number of seconds before the timer elapses).

refs.Alarm$severity: A non-negative integer that reflects the severity level of the alarm.

SimpleRuleEvaluation.base: Information needed to compare two values with a comparison operator.

refs.RuleEvaluation$simpleRuleEvaluation: Information needed to compare two values with a comparison operator.

SnoozeActionConfiguration.base: Contains the configuration information of a snooze action.

refs.CustomerAction$snoozeActionConfiguration: Contains the configuration information of a snooze action.

refs.BatchSnoozeAlarmRequest$snoozeActionRequ: The list of snooze action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.

refs.SnoozeActionConfiguration$snoozeDuration: The snooze time in seconds. The alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state after this duration.
refs.SnoozeAlarmActionRequest$snoozeDuration: The snooze time in seconds. The alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state after this duration.

StateChangeConfiguration.base: Contains the configuration information of alarm state changes.

refs.SystemEvent$stateChangeConfiguration: Contains the configuration information of alarm state changes.

refs.DetectorStateDefinition$stateName: The name of the new state of the detector (instance).
refs.ListDetectorsRequest$stateName: A filter that limits results to those detectors (instances) in the given state.

refs.SimpleRuleEvaluation$thresholdValue: The threshold value, on the right side of the comparison operator.

ThrottlingException.base: The request could not be completed due to throttling.

refs.DetectorStateDefinition$timers: The new values of the detector's timers. Any timer whose value isn't specified is cleared, and its timeout event won't occur.

refs.DetectorState$timers: The current state of the detector's timers.

refs.Alarm$creationTime: The time the alarm was created, in the Unix epoch format.
refs.Alarm$lastUpdateTime: The time the alarm was last updated, in the Unix epoch format.
refs.AlarmSummary$creationTime: The time the alarm was created, in the Unix epoch format.
refs.AlarmSummary$lastUpdateTime: The time the alarm was last updated, in the Unix epoch format.
refs.Detector$lastUpdateTime: The time the detector (instance) was last updated.
refs.DetectorSummary$lastUpdateTime: The time the detector (instance) was last updated.
refs.Timer$timestamp: The number of seconds which have elapsed on the timer.

refs.StateChangeConfiguration$triggerType: The trigger type. If the value is SNOOZE_TIMEOUT, the snooze duration ends and the alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state.

refs.BatchUpdateDetectorRequest$detectors: The list of detectors (instances) to update, along with the values to update.

refs.DetectorStateDefinition$variables: The new values of the detector's variables. Any variable whose value isn't specified is cleared.

refs.DetectorState$variables: The current values of the detector's variables.
